Package com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVPostRestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVPostRestController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class TEVPostRestController
extends Object

    This is the REST controller for working with Post data, including special kinds of posts such as "regular" and "photo" posts.

    Note: The APIs listed here are all blog-specific, even in cases where the blog name shouldn't be necessary. e.g. retrieving a Post by ID shouldn't require a blog name to be specified (there is no reason to assume IDs are not unique across blogs), but the APIs require blog names even in these cases, for consistency.

    Author:
    tiyb

public List<Post> getAllPostsForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")

        Returns:
        List of all posts in the database

      • createPostForBlog

        @PostMapping("/posts/{blog}")
public Post createPostForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                              String blog,
                              @Valid @RequestBody
                              @Valid Post post)
        POST request to submit a Tumblr post into the system for a given blog
        Parameters:
        blog - Name of the blog for which the Post should be inserted
        post - The Post object (in JSON format) to be saved into the database
        Returns:
        The same Post object that was saved (including the ID)

        postId - The Post ID
        Returns:

      • updatePostForBlog

        @PutMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}")
public Post updatePostForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                              String blog,
                              @PathVariable("id")
                              Long postId,
                              @RequestBody
                              Post postDetails)
        PUT to update a Post for a given blog
        Parameters:
        blog - The blog for which this post should be updated (not used, but needs to be consistent with blog specified in Post)
        postId - The ID of the post to be updated
        postDetails - The data to be updated
        Returns:
        The same Post object that was submitted

                                @PathVariable("id")
                                Long postId)
        PUT API for marking a post read for a given blog
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which this post should be marked read (must be consistent with the post from the DB)
        postId - The ID of the post to be marked read
        Returns:
        The modified Post

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAllPostsForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")

      • fixPhotosForBlogForPost

        @GetMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}/fixPhotos")
public Boolean fixPhotosForBlogForPost​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                       String blog,
                                       @PathVariable("id")
                                       Long postId)
        The Tumblr export doesn't always include every image, for some reason. However, in many cases the images referred to in the image URLs from Tumblr's export XML still exist on Tumblr's servers. So, in cases where a post is missing its images, this API can be used to fetch the images from Tumblr's servers (according to their URLs in the XML), download them, and save them to the media directory being used by TEV, using the naming convention Tumblr would have used, if the images had been included in the export. TODO move to admin tools?
        Parameters:
        blog - Not used
        postId - The ID of the post to be "fixed"
        Returns:
        bool indicating whether the action completed successfully or not.

      • getAllHashtagsForBlog

        @GetMapping("/hashtags/{blog}")
public List<Hashtag> getAllHashtagsForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                           String blog)
        GET request for listing all hashtags stored in the system for a given blog
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which hashtags should be returned
        Returns:
        List of all hashtags in the database

      • createHashtagForBlog

        @PostMapping("/hashtags/{blog}")
public Hashtag createHashtagForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                    String blog,
                                    @Valid @RequestBody
                                    @Valid String hashtag)
        POST request to insert a new hashtag into the system for a given blog. If it already exists the existing hashtag is simply returned (no error is thrown).
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which the hashtag should be inserted
        hashtag - The hashtag to be entered into the system
        Returns:
        The new/existing hashtag object (with ID)

      • deleteAllPhotosForBlog

        @DeleteMapping("/posts/{blog}/photos")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAllPhotosForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                                                         String blog)
        DEL to delete all "photo" posts in the DB for a given blog. Because a given Photo post can actually have multiple photos in it, the logic is to retrieve all photo posts for the given blog, then delete each photo for that post.
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which photos should be deleted
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the response details

      • createRegularForBlog

        @PostMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}/regular")
public Regular createRegularForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                    String blog,
                                    @PathVariable("id")
                                    Long postId,
                                    @Valid @RequestBody
                                    @Valid Regular regular)
        POST request to submit a "regular" post into the system. (The naming is awkward, but "regular" is one type of Tumblr post.)
        Parameters:
        blog - Used for validation purposes
        postId - The ID of the post to which this "regular" post content refers
        regular - The data to be submitted
        Returns:
        The same Regular object that was submitted.

        Parameters:
        blog - Not used
        postId - The ID of the post to be updated
        videoDetails - The data to be updated
        Returns:
        The same Video object that was submitted
